comment: TAKE HER!!! Super sweet and one of the best professors I have had. Is a work load heavy class BUT assignments are easy and can be done quickly in my opinion. There are a few negative comments of the Amend episodes but I enjoyed watching them and its easy questions you answer after watching.

Got a 100 as my final grade. 5 quick writes total, 6 document analyzations, 4 discussion boards, 6 amend episode questions, 13 quizzes, 1 midterm essay, and a final project. That's all you have to do. Best professor ever! She is so sweet. TAKE!!!

Absolutely an angel of a professor! The course it self may look like a lot of work but it is very easy content and material, she posts the whole course so you can work ahead. The assignments for the week would take me only a day to complete. Not a tough grader at all!! As long as you put effort you'll receive 100's on your assignments.

You have to do around 3 assignments a week including a quiz, but all of these are easy A's she just gives me 100 on every assignment even when I barely even try on it. She has all assignments posted at beginning of semester so you can go ahead and do them. I highly recommend this class unless you want to really learn and not just have an easy class

This class had a heavy workload, but it was super easy. TBH, if you put in the effort on her assignments, you will get an A. 13 quizzes (no lockdown), Amend episodes that you have to write about (easy just time consuming), and one big project as your final where you take everything you've learned and make a presentation on it.Super easy class TAKE!

Quiz on textbook and various secondary assignments weekly. "Amend" series from Netflix/Youtube, six hour-ish episodes, same questions asked for each. Lots of reflection/analyzation assignments but very simple. Would compare to a high school history class. Four discussions w/ post + two responses. Easy class, prof is touch and go w/ communication.

Most of the work is just analyzing different texts. No lockdown. Best part is that a lot of the assignments are based on personal documentations outside of the textbook. If you prefer analyzing personal accounts and thinking critically over reading textbooks and memorizing then this is the class for you. She actually makes history fun to learn

Easiest A of my life. Few assignments, but she's a very light grader. There is a youtube docuseries assignment which is kind of annoying, but you have the ENTIRE semester to complete them. Honestly would recommend this class to the stupidest person I know.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class--Online Savvy

comment: Idk why someone said this class was heavy work it legit isn't. Easy assignments, and yes, there is a docu-series you watch, but if you put it at 1.5 speed on YouTube, it goes by quicker. No tests or quizzes, just easy writing assignments. Midterm is a paper, and final is a project. MANAGEABLE work, but she grades SLOW! Answers emails late, though.
Dr. McDaniel is very friendly and a great teacher. One of the few online courses that I have enjoyed. There were lots of assignments and lectures for this class, but it was a joy to learn from her.

I mean she's an okay teacher, but she gives too much busy work. I chose this class because I just wanted to be able to look at presentations on my own and have an easier workload This is by far was my heaviest workload class when it shouldn't be. 6 of her assignments each consist of watching a 1 hr documentary and answering questions.

Dr. McDaniel is a great teacher and responds to emails in a somewhat effective manner. Assignments consist of discussions, quick writes, watching a youtube video & answering questions, and midterm & final assignment (not a test). 3-5 lecture videos a week at 20 min to an hour a piece along with extra videos to watch. Does NOT grade quickly.

Dr. McDaniel was great, this was a simple class to follow, with clear assignments and grading criteria. There is an opportunity for extra credit!! I recommend her class if you have a pre req to fill, and are in need of a simple class that will not drown you!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback

comment: very simple course. follow rubrics, and turn in things on time. USE textbook, makes things a lot simpler. take her if you can
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: I thoroughly enjoyed this course with Professor McDaniel! She certainly knows and is passionate about the material. She made learning about history interesting and, dare I say, fun. Assignments were very straightforward and often came straight from the textbook. I highly recommend taking a class with her!
Great teacher. Responds quickly if you ever have questions or need help.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Interesting course! She makes you think thoroughly about history. There is many sensitive topics introduced and she does a well job at explaining them! Class consisted of discussion posts, history episodes, lectures, midterm, and final! She does take a while to respond to emails but she's very lenient and an easy grader. Would recommend her!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Fast replier, and the work is really easy as long as you follow exactly what it says you are bound to get an 100 on homework. She is so good! Take her

I really love how Professor McDaniel really makes an effort to teach the good and the bad history. I genuinely feel like all my other history classes before hers taught me nothing. I have learned so much in this class. Her assignments are easy and the workload is light. She is not the best at answering emails or putting in grades though

I took 1212 online in the spring and it was a breeze. I felt like I was learning history without feeling bored and talked at for an hour. The PPT videos did get tiresome, but she never posted more than 60 minutes worth of content, so it was like a typical lecture. Her assignments felt insightful and the discussions were really engaging.

Her lectures are really long and boring but are basically straight from the textbook. She also never graded anything until the very end. You have to watch a docuseries and write about it but its actually interesting. Grading criteria isn't really clear either and she is not the most tech savvy and responds to emails weeks after.

Professor McDainel is one of the most understanding professors I have ever had during my college experience. her online course is super easy to navigate, she posts lecture videos for each module that are easy to follow along to. Her assignments challenge your knowledge of the course, and she genuinely cares for her students and their well being!
